title: A concept guide is incorrectly listed as a tutorial content type on the new Documentation index page
body:
### Describe the bug

The following documentation page is listed on the Quarkus Documentation index page as a Tutorial.

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/docs/src/main/asciidoc/security-overview-concept.adoc


### Expected behavior

The page should display under the `Concepts` heading on the index page.

### Actual behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92924207/206164681-d02d37ca-1fd0-48e2-a05e-f14d2446e177.png)


### How to Reproduce?

Filename = [security-overview-concept.adoc](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/docs/src/main/asciidoc/security-overview-concept.adoc)
Header = 
```
[id="security-overview-concept"]
= Quarkus Security overview
include::_attributes.adoc[]
:categories: security, getting-started
```

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

This relates to the new landing page look and feel, currently in the `main` preview only. 

The problem is not relevant in the 2.14 and earlier production docs.

REF - [QDOCS-70](https://issues.redhat.com/browse/QDOCS-70) & [QDOCS-68](https://issues.redhat.com/browse/QDOCS-68)
